title: The Tribe
creator_credit: Hubert Bals Fund, Ukrainian State Film Agency, Myroslav Slaboshpytskyi, Vlad Odudenko and Olena Hres
brief_description: A film told entirely through sign language, The Tribe has a unique soundscape, shocking scenes and humanity.

constellations_other.name: Significant sounds
constellations_other.description: The arrival of synchronised sound dramatically changed the movie business, allowing filmmakers to use sound in new and exciting ways which developed the use sound into own film language.

creator_credit_for_label: Hubert Bals Fund, Ukrainian State Film Agency, Myroslav Slaboshpytskyi, Vlad Odudenko and Olena Hres
description: Deaf mute Sergey enters a specialized boarding school for deaf-and-dumb. In this new place, he needs to find his way through the hierarchy of the school’s network dealing with crimes and prostitution, the Tribe. By taking part of several robberies, he gets propelled higher into the organization. Then he meets one of the Chief’s concubines Anya, and unwillingly breaks all the unwritten rules of the tribe.
